item.title: I'm not dead yet!
item.description:
I'm still here! It's been a busy, uh... 18 months?

A few things I've been involved with:

  • parenting a kindergartener, er, now first grader!
  • New HF radio and building my dedicated ham shack!
  • Became the treasurer for my synagogue's board.
item.dc:creator: eheisman

item.title: Repairing a broken connector on a TH-D72 radio
item.description:
I broke the SMA antenna connector on my Kenwood TH-D72A radio recently, and I was surprised to find how easy it was to repair.

Broken

This happens to every handheld radio eventually, right? At least if you are a klutz like me. I dropped it in the garage, appeared undamaged …

item.title: Gardening Tip: Veggie Garden Watering
item.description: Just a quick tip - if you have a lawn / landscaping irrigation system, easier than repurposing a zone or adding a zone for your garden beds, might be to buy a second controller that hooks up to a tap like this one. I found this in my local hardware store along …

item.title: Native Plant Garden
item.description:
Previously...

Over the last few years, we've been trying to reduce the amount of lawn on our small quarter acre property and replace it with native plants, plants for polinators and birds, as well as expanding our vegetable and fruit gardens. This has included a 12ft wide strip of native …

item.title: DDS-60 Signal Generator and VFO
item.description:

I bought a DDS-60 VFO board from Midnight Design Solutions almost a decade ago, with the intent of using it to build a HF antenna analyzer. I built an Arduino shield to hold it, but never got around to the RF power meters required to use it as an …

item.title: Easy Lumber Rack

item.title: Woodworking with my kid

item.title: Ham Radio in WSL
item.description: I have been trying to run my ham radio programs in WSL lately. I've poked around with WSL in the past to run a media servers, but never looked into it much in regards to hardware or porgrams with a GUI. Unfortunately, I haven't found a good SDR receiver software …

item.title: Cider Press

item.title: Remote Control Power Supply
item.description:
Motivation

I've been trying to operate my HF radio station remotely for the last month, using Windows Remote Desktop and WSJT-X to sit and make some FT8 contacts while drinking my morning coffee. This has worked well but I want to remove the step of having to remember to turn …
item.dc:creator: eheisman

item.title: My Ham Shack
item.description:
Circa 2015-early 2023 my hamshack lived in a cabinet in the corner of my living room and consisted of:

  • Icom IC-706 MkIIG
  • LDG Z-100 auto tuner
  • MFJ manual tuner, used for SWR meter and as a switch.
  • WestMountainRadio Rigblaster Plug-and-Play
  • Astron switching power supply

Antennas: - G5RV for HF/6M, currently …
item.dc:creator: eheisman

item.title: Remote HF Antenna Switch
item.description:
Design

I wanted a remote antenna switch, and commercial models seem to be expensive relative to what I am willing to spend. I planned to combine an Arduino, ethernet shield with power over ethernet, and a board with four relays. This assumes that commonly available relay boards would work fine …

item.title: Meteor Scatter Station
item.description:
Plans

One of those magical things that has kept me interested in ham radio all these years has been the idea of bouncing signals off of things, particularly those in space. I've long wanted to give meteor scatter a try, so I want to get my station set up for …

item.title: Homemade house numbers - or, is a CNC machine worth it?
item.description: Around the time I started to get into woodworking, I bought a Shapeoko2 CNC machine during their crowdfunding campaign. item.title: Hand planes
item.description: Before I started woodworking, I always thought handplanes were a quirky part of the woodworking hobby, something that people collected but not commonly used. item.title: Learning Tower
item.description:
Concept

I modified these plans from Ana White by removing the arch shape and using mortise and tenon joints instead of the pocket screws. I could have easily done it with the pocket screws and had a great result, but I wanted to challenge myself doing a whole bunch of …

item.title: Owl House
item.description:
A few years ago we decided to put a screech owl box in our big oak tree. We regularly hear them calling at night during the summer when our windows are open.

I found plans from WDFW and Cornell Lab of Ornithology, which I ended up using the WDFW plans …

Here's a few bits of shop furniture I've built and my thoughts about what I would do different next time. I figure shop furniture is a great place to learn new techniques without worrying about aesthetics. I often use construction lumber and recycled materials for these.

item.title: Woodworking resources
item.description:
Video Channels

  • Rex Kruger (YouTube) - Rex's videos really taught me how to sharpen and use handplanes and I really appreciate his approach to making woodworking with hand tools more accessible.
  • Steve Ramsey (YouTube) - Lots of good introductory videos for power tool woodworking
  • New Yankee Workshop (not YouTube)

Books

  • Rex Kruger's …

item.title: What's here
item.description:
About Me

I'm a water resources engineer by training, who does software development and support of other water resources engineers for a large public agency. When I am not doing that, I dabble in woodworking, birding, organic gardening, photography, and ham radio.

What do I want to do here:
